intro: Fleischmannia fragilis, commonly known as the brittle fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry conditions. Fleischmannia fragilis is known for its short lifespan and rapid growth cycle, making it a unique species in its ecological niche.
